data.title: Bugfix: RenderTexture's draw and drawBundled methods threw exceptions if context was lost.
data.body: It's basically the same issue as was discussed here [627](https://github.com/Gamua/Starling-Framework/pull/627).

data.title: updatePassTextures missing a non-null check
data.body:
Not 100% sure if this issue is generated because of another error trying to access to a texture that already has been disposed but, when checking if the texture needs update (line 372) of FragementFilter class, an attempt to access the first position of the mPassTextures vector causes the 1009 error because it can't find the texture. I guess like I said the reason is that right before that error I found in my logs that my player also generated a 3691 error, which would make sense. Anyhow, I'd suggest to add there a small security check :) 

Cheers!

data.title: Merge
BlendMode.ADD causes black artifacts in Chrome
data.body: No artifact when testing in FlashDevelop, semi opaque black rectangles around the images with BlendMode.ADD in Chrome. The issue does not occur with BlendMode.SCREEN (which i'm using as a fallback).

data.title: Optimization: double vertex and index buffers usage during Stage.drawToBitmapData
data.body:
In Facebook web games to show html (FB popups, for example) over flash with wmode direct we are doing stage screenshots, jpeg them, encode into base64 string and pass it to javascript, which in turn hides flash and replaces it with image received. I think, that’s usual approach for Starling Facebook games.
The problem is that some of our users are getting errors like that sometimes:
ArgumentError: Error #3672: Buffer creation failed. Internal error.
at flash.display3D::Context3D/createVertexBuffer()
at starling.display::QuadBatch/createBuffers()
at starling.display::QuadBatch/syncBuffers()
at starling.display::QuadBatch/renderCustom()
...
which are thrown from random QuadBatches. And for some reason before this change quite a lot of such errors were thrown from drawToBitmapData function. It means, that rendering into bitmap works much worse than usual render for some reason, taking into account, that it happens let’s say once per 10 minutes, and render happens every frame. Probably that’s because buffers are reused in usual rendering.
In this change I reused Starling’s render support object.
Documentation states: “Buffer Creation Failed: if the VertexBuffer3D object could not be created by the rendering context (but additional information about the reason is not available).” So it’s not completely clear for me, why this error happens, but after this change it’s very likely, that new vertex and index buffers won’t be created at all during stage drawing into bitmap. It means twice less GPU memory usage for vertex and index buffers and speed up of the function as there is no need to create them.
Also current implementation doesn’t dispose RenderSupport object created, which can cause GPU memory leaks. And it’s not needed after the change.
The change also includes context validity check, if context isn’t valid, function won’t crash, but will return empty bitmap.
Also it will try to reconfigure back buffer, if it’s needed.
The thing, I’m not sure about is using mClippedViewPort for setProjectionMatrix’s parameters instead of stage, this way it should render only visible stage part, if I’m not mistaken. It seems to me, that it’s more correct behaviour, but I’m not sure.

data.title: RenderSupport.clear() is slow
data.body:
I'm doing some profiling on our game at the minute, as one of the things that stood out was the `Context3D.clear()` call. Normally this is pretty quick, so a quick look at `RenderSupport` class showed that the function is declared like so:

```
public static function clear(rgb:uint=0, alpha:Number=0.0):void
{
    Starling.context.clear(
        Color.getRed(rgb)   / 255.0, 
        Color.getGreen(rgb) / 255.0, 
        Color.getBlue(rgb)  / 255.0,
        alpha);
}
```

Changing it quickly to `Starling.context.clear(0,0,0,1)``dropped the total time spent in``clear()`` from ~380ms to ~34ms, or about 10% of the original (full disclosure: it's a debug build testing on Android).

Perhaps we could just directly declare the red, green, blue rather than calculating them each time?

data.title: Improve performance using Inline metadata
data.body:
Hi,

There were some discussion about using the [ Inline ] metadata for additional performance improvements and I'm opening a feature request here for this.

I've reviewed the Adobe compiler documentation and it states that the [ Inline ] metadata have only effect if the Developer compiles the SWF directly from source code and not using as SWC library.
Tip: The method inlined must be either Final, Static or Global.

My question is that is there any blocking issue which stops you from using this feature anyway?
So users who are using the source code compilation could at least benefit from this..

I've checked and I can compile Starling source into SWC if I change this method as an example (Which would be a good candidate anyway):

```
    [Inline]
    public final function makeCurrent():void
    {
        sCurrent = this;
    }
```

I think this and some other methods would deserve inlining since they are called as an ENTER_FRAME basis.

Thanks!

data.title: Starling Graphics integration (Feature Request)
data.body:
Hi!

I would like to have Your and the Community opinion about integrating Graphics drawing into Starling framework. While StarlingGraphics extension exists, I would like to have a well tested, bug free and highly optimized version which updated regurarly and tuned to perform as best with the core Starling enhancements..
I feel this functionality more tied into a graphics/render engine compared to Asset Manager for example.

Thanks!

data.title: fix travis-ci build
data.body: Set depth to 10 to prevent fatal error reported in #592.

data.title: Button upState texture can only be changed when button is enabled
data.body:
I've seen an strange behaviour. When I try to set the upState texture of a button and it is disabled, the texture is not changed. It's mainly because of this line of code:

`
if (mState == ButtonState.UP) setStateTexture(value);
`

Debugging it, mState has a value of "disabled" so that condition is not met

data.title: Tween on* methods don't set 'this'
Feature Request: Hook for showFatalError
data.body:
Hi,

I'm not making a PR since I want to discuss the feature before.

In short I would like to have some kind of notification for Starling fatal errors which are displayed using the following method

```
private function showFatalError(message:String):void
```
## Why:
- track fatal errors with analytics
- apply some styling for these errors messages (create own display object)
- trigger self recovery commands (like browser window/app self-restart)
## How:
- Option A:

> Use a custom StarlingFatalEvent with a Message payload
- Option B:

Add a custom function hook like:

> setFatalErrorHandler(method:Function) 

Thanks!

data.title: Recurring error with TextField: ArgumentError: Error #3675
data.body:
Hi,

We have a game that has scaled quite a bit. I'm doing stats on uncaught errors in order to track & eliminate the most frequent ones and this one is #1 !

Here is the stack trace that keeps coming up:

ArgumentError: Error #3675
    at starling.textures::ConcreteTexture/uploadBitmapData()
    at starling.textures::Texture$/fromBitmapData()
    at starling.text::TextField/createRenderedContents()
    at starling.text::TextField/redraw()
    at starling.text::TextField/render()
    at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()
    at starling.display::Sprite/render()
    at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()
    at starling.display::Sprite/render()
    at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()
    at starling.core::Starling/render()
    at starling.core::Starling/nextFrame()
    at starling.core::Starling/onEnterFrame()

I have no way of debugging a particular text field since it's in the Starling render loop. 

Whatever the issue is, I don't see why a textfield should be triggering errors in release mode. It should just default to blank in worst case scenarios but causing an app to crash doesn't feel right.

I'm using Starling 1.5.1, seems to occur mainly on Windows Web and Android mobile devices (AIR) (could it be related to lost context?)

Thanks for your help !

data.title: Fix for #626 (Wrong AGALMiniAssembler)
data.body:
Fix for #626 
1. Added new class into extended namespace [source](https://github.com/adobe-flash/graphicscorelib/blob/master/src/com/adobe/utils/extended/AGALMiniAssembler.as)
2. Reverted original class

data.title: Added setRenderTargets method to the RenderSupport
data.body:
As the new Standard profile added the possibility to set multiple render targets I think it would be nice to have a way to acces this functionality from RenderSupport. While MRTs aren't really used by Starling in any way, I think it may prove handy to extension developers since everything related to RTs would be accessible through RenderSupport without mixed calls either to Context3D instance or RenderSupport depending on which version of setRenderTarget you need.

I've also added an optional parameter for enabling depth and stencil buffers if rendering to a texture.

data.title: Bugfix: Error #3694 is thrown if a Texture is created when context is lost
data.body: Texture.empty and Texture.fromAtfData methods threw "Error #3694: The object was disposed by an earlier call of dispose() on it" if context was lost.

data.title: Wrong AgalMiniAssembler version
data.body:
The current AgalMicroAssembler version present in the framework is old and not compatible with new features introduced with Stage3D Standard profile (increased opcode/register counts and more). Seems that the version before #622 was resolved was actually newer than the current one as Adobe forgot to update their Gaming SDK with more recent assembler.

The official Adobe [blog post](http://blogs.adobe.com/flashplayer/2014/09/stage3d-standard-profile.html) presenting Standard profile also points out that assember should be downloaded from [here](https://github.com/adobe-flash/graphicscorelib/blob/master/src/com/adobe/utils/extended/AGALMiniAssembler.as).

data.title: Added FP version check whether to include 'standard' profile
data.body:
Hi,

Since the 'standard' profile is a FP 14+ feature I've added a version check in the array collection.
Do you think its a good solution? I don't think it's necessary to test a non-existing profile when using older FP versions (who knows how do they behave in such case).

Best Regards!

data.title: Fixed Gradle building on Windows
data.body:
Hi,

I've fixed Gradle building + testing on Windows since it was broken due the newly introduced unit tests runner (it was okay on OSX).

Hi,

I've updated the AGALMiniAssembler source from the latest Adobe SDK.
Also I've tested Starling with a game framework and looks OK with it!

data.title: Issues using Starling (Stage3D) on Linux with Chrome Pepper
data.body:
Hi!

I've got problems using Stage3D on Linux:

```
DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
DISTRIB_RELEASE=14.04
DISTRIB_CODENAME=trusty
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS"
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION="14.04.1 LTS, Trusty Tahr"
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS"
VERSION_ID="14.04"
```

Flash Player Info

```
Runtime: Linux x86 | Google Pepper LNX 15,0,0,152 PlugIn
```

First of all, the Stage3D profile auto-detection (using profile option 'auto') does not work:
1. The first 'requestNextProfile' call throws an Error 3702.
2. The second 'requestNextProfile' just hangs, no error and no event feedback

I've tried both 'baselineExtended' and 'baseline', neither works.
The third option, 'baselineConstrained' initializes, but the Display Driver shows:

> Starling - [Starling] Display Driver:Software Hw_disabled=unavailable (Baseline Constrained)

And I see black screen, nothing renders in software mode.

chrome : // gpu shows some interesting information:

```
Graphics Feature Status
Canvas: Software only, hardware acceleration unavailable
Flash: Hardware accelerated
Flash Stage3D: Software only, hardware acceleration unavailable
Flash Stage3D Baseline profile: Software only, hardware acceleration unavailable
Compositing: Hardware accelerated and threaded
Rasterization: Software only, hardware acceleration unavailable
Threaded Rasterization: Enabled
Video Decode: Software only, hardware acceleration unavailable
Video Encode: Hardware accelerated
WebGL: Hardware accelerated
Driver Bug Workarounds
clear_uniforms_before_first_program_use
count_all_in_varyings_packing
disable_post_sub_buffers_for_onscreen_surfaces
Problems Detected
Accelerated 2d canvas is unstable in Linux at the moment
Disabled Features: accelerated_2d_canvas
Stage3D is not supported on Linux: 129848
Disabled Features: flash_stage3d
Accelerated video decode is unavailable on Mac and Linux: 137247, 133828
Disabled Features: accelerated_video_decode
GPU rasterization is whitelisted on N4, N5, N7 and Moto X: 362779
Disabled Features: gpu_rasterization
Additional GPU rasterization whitelist for field trial: 380694
Disabled Features: gpu_rasterization_field_trial
Clear uniforms before first program use on all platforms: 124764, 349137
Applied Workarounds: clear_uniforms_before_first_program_use
Mesa drivers in Linux handle varyings without static use incorrectly: 333885
Applied Workarounds: count_all_in_varyings_packing
Disable partial swaps on linux drivers: 339493
Applied Workarounds: disable_post_sub_buffers_for_onscreen_surfaces
```

Detection result from here: https://helpx.adobe.com/x-productkb/multi/stage3d-unsupported-chipsets-drivers-flash.html

```
Your gpu does not supports Stage3D in Baseline or Constrained profile.
Baseline RenderMode: 
Software Hw_disabled=unavailable
Constrained RenderMode: 
Software Hw_disabled=unavailable (Baseline Constrained)
```

Interestingly, other Stage3D example works, like:
- http://feathersui.com/examples/components-explorer/
- http://gamua.com/starling/demo/
  I'm not sure what version of the framework these include..

Notes: 
- It's quite hard to debug Flash Player issues on Linux, since there is no Debug Player.
- I've tried to switch Stage3D error reporting on, but no luck

I'll try to strip my testing application into a more compact, shareable version, but until than, I need some feedback from other Linux Chrome users, that Stage3D is working on their machine.
Also additional testing of the 'auto' profile detection on Linux would be welcomed, if possible.

data.title: Added new 'standard' profile into 'auto' profile detection
data.body:
Hi,

I've added the missing 'standard' profile into the auto-detection array (first one, I hope it's in the correct place).

More info about the profile itself:

https://blogs.adobe.com/flashplayer/2014/09/stage3d-standard-profile.html

Best,
Andrew

data.title: Allow QuadBatch to be replaced with a custom implementation

milestone.title: Starling 2.0
milestone.description: This release will come with a much more flexible rendering architecture and some other changes I've been wishing to make for a long time. It won't be compatible with the old releases, though: several APIs will change.

data.body:
I'm currently struggling with making my [Starling deferred renderer](https://github.com/Varnius/StarlingRendererPlus) a standalone extension without the need for Starling fork to lurk around there somewhere containing the bits of modified code that I can't really override in the extension itself. Since I wanted the extension to work with regular Starling objects like Quad and Image without breaking batching, my only option was to modify QuadBatch and fork Starling to do so because currently there is no way to override the default QuadBatch. 

So what about adding a possibility for a developer to configure an instance of Starling to use a custom QuadBatch class which could simply be required to be a subclass with overridden functionality (because introducing an IQuadBatch interface would require much more work, I suppose)? Internally, this would require to replace all instances of:

``` actionscript
new QuadBatch()
```

with a factory call like

``` actionscript
QuadBatchFactory.getInstance()
```

which would return an instance of custom QuadBatch class if it's specified or default QuadRenderer otherwise.

I personally don't see any serious performance (or other) implications but I may be missing something, for example, compatibility with other extensions, like Feathers, where QuadBatch objects would be initialized using "new".

data.title: Fix issue with highResolutionDisplay
data.body:
Hi,

On my macbook pro retina, the drawToBitmapData function was a little bit broken.
It does not take into account the contentScaleFactor.
This change fix it on my laptop, but I'm not sure it does not introduce another bug as I have trouble understanding the subtleties of mContentScaleFactor versus mNativeStageContentScaleFactor in Starling.

Thanks,

Seb

data.title: add missing unit tests for starling.utils package
TouchEvent handler is called on every frame if it throws Exception, instead called once
CallLater [request]
Non pma textures and the color matrix filter
data.body: I think I've found an issue with the color matrix filter when using non pma textures see http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/bug-with-colormatrix-filter-for-atf

data.title: Fix "Texture size is zero" error
data.body:
Error repeat requirements:
1. Use `Texture.empty(width, height)`. (`width > 0` and `width < 1`)
2. Starling.contentScaleFactor < 1
So, `var origWidth:int = width * Starling.contentScaleFactor`, `origWidth` will be `0`. And `flash.display3D::Context3D/createRectangleTexture` throw `ArgumentError: Error #3681: Texture size is zero.`
